metadata.description: Master YouTube keyword research to find topics your audience searches for. Tools, techniques, and strategies for video SEO.

hero.headline: YouTube Keyword Research: Find Topics That Get Views
hero.subheadline: Discover what your audience is searching for and create content that ranks.

sections.content: Keyword research helps you create videos people actually search for. Instead of guessing topics, you find proven demand. This guide covers free and paid tools, research techniques, and how to incorporate keywords into your content strategy for maximum discoverability.

content.title: YouTube Autocomplete
content.description: Free and accurate. Start typing your topic and YouTube suggests popular searches.

content.title: Dedicated Tools

faq.question: How do I know if a keyword is too competitive?
faq.answer: Check who ranks for it. If top results are all huge channels, look for longer-tail variations. VidIQ and TubeBuddy provide competition scores.

faq.question: Are tags still important for YouTube SEO?
faq.answer: Less than before, but still worth using. Put primary keyword first, add variations. Don't expect tags alone to drive discovery.

faq.question: Should I optimize for Google or YouTube search?
faq.answer: Both. YouTube videos appear in Google search results. Focus on YouTube search intent first, but Google-friendly titles help with external discovery.

faq.question: How many keywords should I target per video?
faq.answer: One primary keyword, 2-3 secondary variations. Don't keyword stuff. Create content that thoroughly covers the topic naturally.
